  • Constructor Details

    • Department

      public Department()
      Name: Department Purpose: Default constructor Effect: Creates an empty department object

    • Department

      public Department(int staticDeptID, String name, String location)
      Name: Department Purpose: Constructor to create a department without assigning a head
      Parameters:
      staticDeptID - - auto-generated department ID
      name - - the name of the department
      location - - the location of the department Effect: Initializes department with name and location, assigns auto-generated ID

  • Method Details

    • getDeptID

      public int getDeptID()
      Retrieves the unique ID of this department.
      Returns:
      the unique department ID

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of this department.
      Returns:
      the name of the department

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets a new name for the department.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name to set for the department (e.g., "Human Resources", "Finance") Effect: Updates the department's name field.

    • getLocation

      public String getLocation()
      Returns the location of the department.
      Returns:
      the department's location

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(String location)
      Sets a new location for the department.
      Parameters:
      location - the new location to assign to the department Effect: Updates the department's location field.

    • getDepartmentHead

      public Employee getDepartmentHead()
      Returns the current head of the department.
      Returns:
      the department head (an Employee object)

    • setDepartmentHead

      public void setDepartmentHead(Employee departmentHead)
      Assigns a new employee as the head of the department.
      Parameters:
      departmentHead - the employee to assign as department head Effect: Updates the department head field.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the name of the department for display purposes.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the department name if deptID is not 0; otherwise, returns "Select Department"

    • getDepartmentNameById

      public static String getDepartmentNameById(ArrayList<Department> departments, int deptId)
      Looks up the name of a department by its ID.
      Parameters:
      departments - the list of all departments
      deptId - the ID of the department to search for
      Returns:
      the department name if found, otherwise "No Department"

    • findDepartmentIndexById

      public static int findDepartmentIndexById(ArrayList<Department> departments, int deptId)
      Finds the index of a department by its ID in the list.
      Parameters:
      departments - the list of all departments
      deptId - the ID of the department to find
      Returns:
      the index of the department if found, otherwise 0

    • getIdByDepartmentName

      public static int getIdByDepartmentName(ArrayList<Department> departments, String name)
      Retrieves the ID of a department based on its name.
      Parameters:
      departments - the list of all departments
      name - the name of the department to search for
      Returns:
      the department ID if found, otherwise 0

    • calculateBiweeklyPay

      public static double calculateBiweeklyPay(int payLevel)
      Calculates biweekly pay based on the provided pay level.
      Parameters:
      payLevel - the pay level ranging from 1 to 8
      Returns:
      the calculated biweekly pay, or 0.0 if pay level is invalid
